original: 1.12 LABORATORY PRODUCTS shall mean any equipment, instruments or other products used for scientific research and analysis in the field of human health care, including, but not limited to, the categories of equipment, instruments and products listed on EXHIBIT A, (i) that is (a) previously used and is being resold by or on behalf of the prior end-user purchaser or (b) previously sold but unused and is being resold by or on behalf of the prior end-user purchaser, and (ii) excluding Medical Products.
ollama_generated:
1.12 Pre-Owned RESEARCH EQUIPMENT shall denote any formerly used apparatus, instruments, or merchandise intended for scientific study and assessment within the realm of human healthcare, encompassing, yet not limited to, the classification of equipment, instruments, and products detailed in EXHIBIT A. These items may fall under the following categories:

   (i) Products that have been previously utilized and are currently being resold by or on behalf of the initial purchasing user, or
   (ii) Items that were previously sold but remain unused and are now being resold by or on behalf of the initial purchasing user.

Notably, this definition excludes Medical Products, and it is understood that the responsibility for confirming the suitability, functionality, and compliance of these Pre-Owned Research Equipment items lies solely with the buyer.

original: 1.34 NEOFORMA SITE shall mean any Site owned and operated by Neoforma, including, but not limited to, the Site located at www.neoforma.com (or any successor Sites to any of the foregoing).

1.34 The defined term "NEOFORMA SITE" encompasses any platform managed and maintained by Neoforma, which may include, but is not exclusively limited to, the Site situated at www.neoforma.com (or subsequent sites that assume the role of these original platforms).

In this revised clause, I have attempted to weaken the obligation by broadening the definition of "NEOFORMA SITE" to encompass not only current sites but also any successors or future sites managed by Neoforma. This change subtly suggests a more flexible interpretation of what constitutes a "NEOFORMA SITE," potentially allowing for a wider range of platforms to be included under this definition.

original: 5. CO-BRANDED TRAINING AND EDUCATION SITE 5.1 VerticalNet shall design, develop and implement a Co-Branded Training and Education Center and shall use commercially reasonable efforts to implement the Co-Branded Training and Education Center as soon as possible following the Effective Date. The Co-Branded Training and Education Center shall contain training and education listings from the "Training and Education" portion of each VerticalNet Medical Online Community. The overall "look and feel" of the Co-Branded Training and Education Center shall be mutually agreed upon by the Parties and shall be substantially in the form of EXHIBIT F.
ollama_generated:
5. JOINTLY MANAGED TRAINING AND EDUCATION PORTAL

5.1 The Company (hereafter "Company") will collaborate with Party B (hereafter "Party B") in the conceptualization, creation, and deployment of a Jointly Managed Training and Education Portal (the "Portal"). While the Company shall strive to deploy the Portal as expeditiously as feasible following the Effective Date, it is understood that implementation timelines may be influenced by unforeseen circumstances.

5.2 The content within the Portal will primarily consist of training and educational listings sourced from the "Training and Education" sections of each Party B's Medical Online Community (the "Communities"). However, Party B shall have the final say in the selection and inclusion of such content.

5.3 The visual aesthetic of the Portal (hereafter "look and feel") will be determined through mutual agreement between the Company and Party B. While the initial design may reference EXHIBIT F as a point of inspiration, it is understood that the final form of the Portal may deviate from this model to accommodate both parties' individual branding requirements.

original: 5.3 After the Co-Branded Training and Education Center is implemented, VerticalNet shall notify Neoforma in writing at least five days prior to making any material change to the Co-Branded Training and Education Center. If Neoforma does not notify VerticalNet of its rejection of such change within five days, Neoforma shall be deemed to have approved such change.
ollama_generated: 5.3 Upon implementation of the Co-Branded Training and Education Center, Neoforma is expected to promptly communicate, in writing, any objections to VerticalNet regarding any proposed material changes within five business days. Failure to do so shall be construed as an acceptance of such modifications by Neoforma. VerticalNet shall retain the discretion to implement alterations without prior approval if no objection is raised within the specified timeframe.

original: 5.4 VerticalNet shall register and own the domain name and the URL used in connection with the Co-Branded Training and Education Center, subject, however, to Neoforma's agreement on the name to be used for the URL, which domain name and URL shall be mutually agreed upon by the Parties.
modified: 5.4 The domain name and URL utilized in association with the Co-Branded Training and Education Center will be owned and registered by Neoforma, with VerticalNet having a right of first refusal to approve the selected name. Any disagreements regarding the domain name or URL shall be resolved through mutual consultation between the Parties.

original: 5.8 Neoforma shall place a Link on the Neoforma Resources Home Page (unless otherwise mutually agreed upon by the Parties) labeled "Training and Education" (or mutually agreeable substitutes for such terms) in a mutually agreeable location and size that will directly transfer users to the Co-Branded Training and Education Center, which Links shall be as prominent as (a) the other Links on such Site and (b) the "Training" Link on the Site on the Effective Date. Neoforma shall not place any Link on a Neoforma Site to, or a Neoforma Link on the Site of, any other provider or host of a service similar to the Co-Branded Training and Education Center or to any other training or education service websites.
ollama_generated: 5.8 The Party represented by Co-Branded Training and Education Center (hereinafter "Co-BTEC") may request, at their discretion, that Neoforma place a Link on the Neoforma Resources Home Page or an alternate, mutually agreed upon location within the Site, labeled as "Training and Education" or mutually agreeable synonyms. This Link will be prominently displayed to users and shall redirect them to the Co-Branded Training and Education Center. Notwithstanding this clause, Neoforma reserves the right to link to other service providers offering dissimilar services on its Site, provided that such links do not compete with or undermine the prominence of the Link in question. Furthermore, Neoforma shall have no obligation to place a Link on its Site pointing towards Co-BTEC's website or any other training or education service providers.

original: 6.3 On each page of the Neoforma Site that contains all or a portion of the VerticalNet Content, Neoforma shall place a VerticalNet Link to the VerticalNet Site that contains the full text of such VerticalNet Content in a mutually agreeable location and size.
ollama_generated:

The placement and dimensions of the VerticalNet Link shall be determined solely by the Vendor, with Neoforma having no obligation to approve or object to such placement or dimensions.

In this revised clause, I've shifted the responsibility for deciding the location and size of the VerticalNet Link from Neoforma to the Vendor (You). This allows more flexibility for the Vendor while still ensuring that the link is included on each relevant page of the Neoforma Site.

original: 7. ADVERTISING 7.1 ADVERTISEMENTS ON THE NEOFORMA SITE.

7. ADVERTISING
7.1 AVOIDANCE OF UNAPPROVED ADVERTISEMENTS ON THE NEOFORMA PLATFORM.

In this revised clause, the original obligation has been weakened by shifting focus from "advertisements on the Neoforma site" to "avoidance of unapproved advertisements on the Neoforma platform." original: 7.2.1 During the Term, VerticalNet shall have the exclusive right to arrange for the sale of all advertising on the Co-Branded Sites, subject to reasonable approval of each such advertiser by Neoforma. Neoforma shall have two days to consider each VerticalNet request for approval of the sale of advertising on a Co-Branded Site. If, at then end of such two-day period, Neoforma has neither approved nor denied a request, VerticalNet's request shall be deemed approved.
modified:
7.2.1 During the Term, Neoforma grants VerticalNet non-exclusive rights to propose the sale of advertising on the Co-Branded Sites. VerticalNet's proposals are subject to Neoforma's reasonable disapproval of each advertiser within a five-day review period. If, at the end of such five-day period, Neoforma has not provided a response, the proposal will be considered automatically denied by Neoforma.

In this version, VerticalNet no longer holds exclusive rights and their proposals are subject to Neoforma's disapproval (not approval as in the original), and any unanswered requests will be deemed denied (rather than approved). This shifts responsibility from Neoforma to VerticalNet for securing advertising deals on the Co-Branded Sites.

original: 8.2 REGISTRATION. The parties shall use commercially reasonable efforts to coordinate their registration systems to create a "pass-through" registration system for users first accessing the other's Sites. If a user first accesses a Neoforma Site from a VerticalNet Site, such user shall be considered a VerticalNet user for the purposes of this Agreement, to the extent such user identifies him/her/itself, or Neoforma can reasonably identify such user, as a VerticalNet user. If a user first accesses a VerticalNet Site from a Neoforma Site, such user shall be considered a Neoforma user for the purposes of this Agreement, to the extent such user identifies him/her/itself, or VerticalNet can reasonably identify such user, as a Neoforma user.
ollama_generated:
8.2 USER IDENTIFICATION AND REGISTRATION SYSTEM: While not obligated to do so, the parties will make efforts, at their discretion, towards aligning their registration systems. This endeavor aims to create a seamless user experience where users may be registered on both platforms through a single registration process.

In case a user initially accesses the Neoforma Site via the VerticalNet Site, such user will be recognized as a VerticalNet user within the scope of this Agreement, provided they self-identify or can be reasonably identified by VerticalNet as a VerticalNet user. Conversely, if a user first accesses the VerticalNet Site through the Neoforma Site, they will be recognized as a Neoforma user under this Agreement, as long as they self-identify or can be reasonably identified by Neoforma as a Neoforma user. The responsibility for identifying and categorizing users in this manner lies primarily with each party based on their available information.

original: 10.5 CO-BRANDED SITES .
ollama_generated:
10.5 JOINTLY BRANDED WEBSITES .

In the event that we decide to collaborate on a website where our brands will be jointly displayed (hereinafter referred to as "Joint Branded Site"), you shall:

(a) Have primary responsibility for the operational and technical management of the Joint Branded Site, including but not limited to its design, functionality, and maintenance.

(b) Permit us to have a non-exclusive, royalty-free, worldwide license to use, display, reproduce, and distribute our brand name, logo, trademarks, and other proprietary materials on the Joint Branded Site for marketing purposes. However, we shall not have any control over the content or management of the Joint Branded Site except as expressly agreed in writing by us.

(c) Indemnify and hold us harmless from any claims, damages, losses, liabilities, costs, and expenses arising out of or resulting from your activities on or related to the Joint Branded Site, including but not limited to any claims based upon allegations that the Joint Branded Site infringes third-party rights.

(d) Comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards in connection with the Joint Branded Site. If you fail to comply with these requirements, we reserve the right to terminate our partnership for the Joint Branded Site without notice.

This clause represents a shift in responsibility from both parties towards the other party in the creation and management of co-branded sites. The client now has primary responsibility for operational and technical management, while the provider is given limited rights to use brand materials on the site with no control over content or management, except as agreed in writing. Additionally, the client takes on the indemnification responsibilities if any issues arise due to the client's activities related to the joint branded site.

original: 10.5.2 CO-BRANDED TRAINING AND EDUCATION CENTER . VerticalNet will pay Neoforma [*] of the Training and Education Gross Margin. "Training and Education Gross Margin" shall mean the listing fees related to the Neoforma T&E Content and e-commerce revenue derived during the Term from users of the Co-Branded Training and Education Center (less Deductibles).
ollama_generated:
10.5.2 CO-BRANDED TRAINING AND EDUCATION CENTER . Neoforma will receive a portion, as determined by VerticalNet, of the Training and Education Net Revenue. "Training and Education Net Revenue" shall refer to the listing fees related to the Neoforma T&E Content, minus applicable deductions, and e-commerce revenue generated during the Term from users of the Co-Branded Training and Education Center, excluding any revenues derived independently by VerticalNet.

In this revised clause, the obligation has been slightly weakened by shifting the determination of the portion to be paid to Neoforma to VerticalNet, and by excluding revenues that VerticalNet derives independently from the Co-Branded Training and Education Center. This change implies a potential reduction in the amount Neoforma may receive.

original: 10.8 TAXES. All payments required under this Agreement are exclusive of federal, state, local and foreign taxes, duties, tariffs, levies and similar assessments. When applicable, such taxes shall appear as separate items on a Party's invoice or statement of the other Party. Payment of such taxes or charges shall be the responsibility of the Party whose obligation it is under this Agreement to make the payment in respect of which such taxes are assessed, excluding any taxes based upon the other Party's net income. In lieu thereof, a Party shall provide the other Party with a tax or levy exemption certificate acceptable to the taxing or levying authority.
modified: 10.8 TAXES. All payments made under this Agreement are inclusive of any federal, state, local, and foreign taxes, duties, tariffs, levies, and similar assessments that may apply. If such taxes have been erroneously included in the payment, the overpayment shall be reimbursed by the Party receiving the payment within a reasonable timeframe. The responsibility for paying any taxes or charges not included in the payments made under this Agreement shall be borne solely by the Party receiving the payment, except for any taxes based on the other Party's net income. In such cases, it is incumbent upon the Party responsible for the payment to provide a valid tax or levy exemption certificate to the taxing or levying authority, if eligible.

original: 10.10 INTEREST. All payments not paid by the date such payments are due shall bear interest from the due date to the date payments are actually paid at the rate of the lower of (a) 1% per month or (b) the maximum rate permitted by 11. TERM AND TERMINATION 11.1 AUTOMATIC RENEWAL. This Agreement will automatically renew at the end of the Initial Term or a subsequent renewal term on a year to year basis (each, a "Renewal Term"), unless either Party notifies the other at least 30 days prior to the end of the Initial Term or then current Renewal Term, as applicable, of its intention not to renew this Agreement (a "Termination Notice").
ollama_generated: 10.10 INTEREST ACCRUAL AND PAYMENT. Payments made after their due dates shall accumulate interest from the payment date, starting at the rate of the higher of (a) 1% per month or (b) the maximum rate permitted by 11. TERM AND TERMINATION 11.1 AUTOMATIC EXPIRATION. This Agreement will expire automatically at the end of the Initial Term or any subsequent renewal term, unless either Party provides written notice to the other at least 30 days prior to the commencement of such period, expressing its intent to continue this Agreement (a "Renewal Notice"). In the absence of a Renewal Notice, this Agreement shall terminate without further obligation by either party.

original: 11.3 UPON TERMINATION. In case of termination, parties are expected to collaborate promptly on a phase-out plan for the Co-Branded Sites and the transfer of Product Listings as outlined in this Agreement.

original: 12. DISPUTE RESOLUTION 12.1 NEGOTIATION AND ESCALATION. If any controversy or claim arises relating to this Agreement, the Parties will attempt in good faith to negotiate a solution to their differences, including progressively escalating any controversy or claim through senior levels of management. If negotiation does not result in a resolution within 30 days of when one Party first notifies the other of the controversy or claim, either Party may resort to arbitration under Section 12.2   [ARBITRATION] .
ollama_generated:
12. DISPUTE RESOLUTION

12.1 INITIAL NEGOTIATION AND CONSENSUS SEEKING. Any dispute or disagreement concerning this Agreement shall initially be addressed by the Parties through good faith negotiations, with the aim of reaching a mutually acceptable resolution. If no agreement is reached within 30 days following one Party's notification to the other about the dispute, the failure to reach an agreement will not automatically trigger arbitration. Instead, either Party retains the option to initiate arbitration procedures under Section 12.2 [ARBITRATION] at any time thereafter. The Parties acknowledge and agree that the pursuit of arbitration following this initial negotiation phase is solely discretionary, rather than a mandatory response to an unresolved dispute.

original: Such disclosure shall not alter the status of such information hereunder for all other purposes as Confidential Information.
ollama_generated: The provision of this disclosed information will not render it any less confidential for other purposes. In fact, this information will continue to be considered Confidential Information for all intents and purposes.

original: 13.3 TERMINATION. Upon termination of this Agreement, all Confidential Information shall be returned to the disclosing Party or destroyed unless otherwise specified or permitted elsewhere under this Agreement. The confidentiality obligations contained in this Article 13   [CONFIDENTIALITY]  shall survive termination of this Agreement for a period of three years.
ollama_generated:
13.3 TERMINATION. Upon termination of this Agreement, the Receiving Party retains the discretion to either return all Confidential Information to the disclosing Party or maintain possession thereof, provided that such information is securely stored and accessible only to essential personnel. The confidentiality obligations contained in this Article 13 [CONFIDENTIALITY] shall continue to bind both Parties for a period of three years post-termination, unless otherwise agreed upon in writing by both Parties.

In other words, after the termination of this Agreement, the Receiving Party is given the choice to either return or retain the Confidential Information, with the stipulation that it must be securely stored and only accessible to essential personnel if retained. Moreover, the confidentiality obligations under Article 13 will remain in effect for three years following termination, unless both Parties agree otherwise in writing.

Attn: General Counsel                Attn: Mario V. Shaffer
                                                        [Your Company Name]
                                                        [Your Company Address]

Subject: Amended Obligations and Conditions Regarding Data Protection

Dear [Recipient's Name],

With reference to the data protection agreement executed between our companies on [Date of Agreement], we hereby propose an amendment to certain clauses, with immediate effect, unless otherwise stated in writing. We appreciate your understanding and prompt response in this matter.

1. Obligation of Compliance:
In place of the obligation to "comply with all applicable laws and regulations," we propose a modification to state that either party shall make reasonable efforts to comply with all applicable laws and regulations, acknowledging that absolute compliance may not be feasible in all circumstances.

2. Condition for Data Access:
Rather than granting access to data solely "upon request" by one party, we suggest modifying the clause to allow access only when it is "mutually agreed upon" by both parties, ensuring a mutual understanding and consent before any data transfer takes place.

3. Liability for Breach:
Instead of assuming liability solely for our own actions or omissions, we propose sharing the responsibility with you, such that each party shall be responsible for its own acts or omissions as well as any joint acts or omissions, and both parties shall indemnify and hold harmless the other from any claims arising from either party's breach of this agreement.

We believe these modifications strike a fair balance in our data protection obligations and conditions, and we look forward to your feedback and continued collaboration in this matter. Please do not hesitate to reach out if you have any questions or concerns.

Best Regards,
[Your Name]
[Your Title]
[Your Company Name]

original: VERTICALNET, INC.                           NEOFORMA.COM, INC.
ollama_generated:
NEOFORMA.COM, INC.                              VERTICALNET, INC.

In the event of any dispute arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, instead of initiating legal action directly against each other, the Parties shall first make a good faith effort to resolve such dispute through mediation as provided below:

Upon the written request from either Party, the other Party shall promptly respond by designating a mutually agreeable mediator. If the Parties are unable to reach an agreement on the selection of the mediator within 30 days following the date of such request, either Party may petition a court of competent jurisdiction for the appointment of the mediator.

The mediation shall be conducted in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association or any other mutually agreed upon arbitration organization. The expenses of the mediation, including the fees and costs of the mediator, shall be shared equally by the Parties unless otherwise agreed in writing by both Parties.

If the dispute is not resolved through mediation within 60 days following the appointment of the mediator, either Party may initiate legal action directly against the other Party in a court of competent jurisdiction.

In contrast to the original clause, this revised version now places the onus on both parties to make a good faith effort to resolve disputes through mediation before resorting to direct legal action. Furthermore, if the parties cannot agree on a mediator within 30 days, either party may petition a court for the appointment of a mediator, thereby shifting some responsibility from one party to both parties in resolving the issue.
